project.name: Hammer
project.presentation: API from a developer to other developers
project.description:
API that exposes services normally used by developers. Currently integrates with GitHub, LinkedIn and Twitter.

This API is ready to be deployed to AWS Ellastic Beanstalk, so developers can easily consume the endpoints when building their portfolio page or mobile app.

It is a read-only API, and only discloses information already public, so no authentication mechanism is provided.

Libraries

  • Powered by Symfony
  • Integration with GitHub through php-github-api
  • Integration with LinkedIn through linkedin-api-php-client
  • Integration with Twitter through twitteroauth
  • Documentation provided by NelmioApiDocBundle

References

  • My own instance and its documentation
project.keywords: API, PHP, Symfony, AWS, Elastic Beanstalk, GitHub, LinkedIn, Twitter

project.name: Pocket
project.description:
Pocket is a collection of scripts to help calculate currency exchanges.

Pocket integrates with Transferwise to determine the current exchange rate between to currency and calculate the value of a rate to obtain a certain profit.

Pocket is built in Python and available as an API. It is deployed to AWS using Zappa (using Lambda and API Gateway services behind the scenes).

Libraries

  • Powered by Flask
  • Deployment to AWS API Gateway / Lambda using Zappa

project.name: Fusebox
project.description:
Music recommendation system that integrates Spotify with Slack.

At Pixel Fusion, we normally have background music playing from Spotify. It is not easy to please everyone and only a few people have control over the playlist. To give everyone access to the playlist, an integration with Slack was built that allows employees to queue new songs and lets everyone rate them. Based on audio features and ratings, machine learning is used to dynamically manage the playlist, removing and adding songs as it sees fit.

The project is powered by Python/Django and deployed to AWS through Jenkins.

Libraries

  • Powered by Django
  • Integration of Spotify's API through spotipy package
  • Integration of Slack's api through python-slackclient library
project.keywords: Python, Django, Jenkins, Machine Learning, Slack, Spotify

project.name: Zorbus
project.presentation: Zorbus is a content managment system built on top of Symfony2
project.description:
Zorbus has the goal to create a content managment system on top of Symfony2 framework.

Zorbus is made of several bundles, and makes it easy to manage pages on a website through drap and drop.

All the bundles are available on GitHub and Packagist and can be used independently of Zorbus in any Symfony2 project.

At the moment, Zorbus is made of the following bundles in alphabetic order:

ZorbusArticleBundle
An article can be seen like a post in a blog, an easy way to publish categorized and tagged content.
ZorbusBannerBundle
Create banners and slideshows.
ZorbusBlockBundle
In the Zorbus perspective, a page is made up of blocks.
ZorbusDocumentBundle
A document is a downloaded file that can be linked from any content published on the site.
ZorbusGalleryBundle
Organize photos into albuns.
ZorbusGlossaryBundle
Manage glossaries and their term definitions.
ZorbusLinkBundle
Group links in a hierarchy way.
ZorbusMenuBundle
This bundle allows to create hierarchy menus.
ZorbusNewsletterBundle
A bundle to manage newsletters.
ZorbusPageBundle
A page is made up of blocks, metadata and url.
ZorbusPollBundle
Ask your users their preferences with polls.
ZorbusTrafficBundle
Monitors the traffic of the website registering inbound and outbund links

All the bundles have entities (no odm support at the moment) and admin classes integrated with the SonataAdminBundle.

You can easily setup Zorbus using composer. Just create a new project using the ZorbusBootstrap repository. Follow the five configuration steps and you are ready to go.

In case you want to give it a go, test it online using zorbus as username and 1234567 as password.

Feel free to improve it and report issues.

project.name: Symfony2Bootstrap
project.presentation: A web interface to ease the process of setting a new Symfony2 project
project.description:
The setup of a Symfony2 project is repetitive and slow.

We end up picking configuring composer to add new repositories and new packages and wait for it to download and setup.

This project aims to ease the process by offering a web interface that allows user to select the Symfony version, the repositories and a bundles to be included and takes care of all the process.

There is a demo online not really functional because my server has limited resources but you are free to download the project on GitHub and test it on your own box.

I consider it would be nice to have an official version by Symfony the same way TwitterBootstrap or JQuery UI offers.

project.name: tmcI18nPlugin
project.presentation: A symfony 1.4 plugin that adds MySQL support for internationalization instead of XLIFF files
project.description:
The use of XLIFF files for translation is not pratical, specially if the person editing the file does not know much about xml format.

This plugin offers the possibility to use a MySQL backend for translations.

Features

  • Automatically clears cache when a new entry is added
  • Allows the extraction of translations from PHP files
  • Database backend that can be integrated with symfony admin generator

Check the GitHub repository for deployment instructions.
